intro: Knautia turocensis, commonly known as the Turoc Mountains knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are basal, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Knautia turocensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
